Do bug reports go in suggestions? I don't know. Anyway, I found a really annoying bug with space junk and timewarp. I have a rocket. The rocket has a launch stage and a cruiser stage. I decouple the launch stage from the cruiser stage. The camera does the COM change and moves but the launch stage stays put even when applying thrust. The only way of fixing this is to timewarp. So I timewarp till the cruiser stage is far enough away and then kill the timewarp. Suddenly the launch stage shoots at high speeds at back at the cruiser and blows it up. ?!!??!!?!?!?!!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!??!!?

OK this is clearly a bug and nothing I am doing wrong. Squad, I hope this is fixed in the next update.

I know some other peeps who have this problem. I dont, and i cant help either, but i will do some research on it.

Your launch stage might be clipped in your cruiser stage, maybe that is why they stick together and are quickly brought together when exiting time warp. Can't really think of anything else right now.

And words are pretty useful when it comes to describing bugs. A picture shows what happens, logs can show why it happens.
